articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Taesongsan General Hospital
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Taesongsan General Hospital 
						
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un visited the Taesongsan General Hospital being built by the People's Army.
					 The hospital covering a total plottage of more than 100 000 square meters has three sick wards. It has all facilities for treatment and resuscitation.
					
					 After being briefed on the construction of the hospital before a guide map, Kim Jong Un looked round its different places for a long while to learn in detail about its construction.
					
					 Watching a painting portraying smiling leader Kim Jong Il in the lobby, he said the hospital could be built thanks to his profound loving care.
					
					In the lobby, he said: "As I stressed while going round this place last year, it is important to provide all amenities favorable for healthcare and treatment of patients while building it splendidly and fashionably".
					
					 Watching the signboard "Yaknaejuneun Got" past the lobby, he said it is better to write signboards not only in Korean but in foreign languages.
					
					 While walking the corridor, he underscored the necessity to put on walls visual aids introducing medical knowledge of relevant sections and benches.
					
					 At the endoscope room and laboratory he learned about specifications of equipment and their installing.
					
					 At an operation room, he underlined the need to cover its walls with plastic veneer.
					
					 At an intensive treatment room, he asked if it is equipped with a real-time monitoring system.
					
					  He expressed satisfaction with an effective use of space in the abdominal surgical department, underlining the need to make a good use of space when building not only hospitals but other structures appropriate to their usage and characters.
					
					 To this end, it is important to properly design and construct objects  and make strict inspection before their inauguration, he said.
					
					 Looking round various operation rooms, he asked in detail if they are completely free from germ and dust.
					
					 At sick-rooms, he praised the builders for constructing them in such a way as to keep them warm and clean so that patients may not have any inconveniences.
					
					 Noting that a children's hospital, a dental hospital and a resuscitation center are to be built in the heart of Pyongyang this year, he said it is necessary to build them successfully so that they may be impeccable in any aspect by applying good experience gained from the building of the Taesongsan General Hospital.
					
					 He underscored the need to build pavilions and plant lots of trees to create good environment for the patients' walk before winding up the construction of the hospital and thus construct a fashionable one.
					
					 He called for successfully managing and operating the hospital.
					
					 He underlined the need to raise the level of science and IT in the field of medical science in order to improve healthcare.
					
					 After expressing satisfaction with the construction of the hospital, he extended thanks to the Korean People's Army Unit 462 for building it and promised to visit it again after its completion.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae, Pak To Chun, Kim Kyong Ok, Ri Jae Il, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Ma Won Chun, Ho Hwan Chol and Jon Chang Bok.

articles.title: Indian Party Leader Voice Invariable Support for Korean People
articles.content:
Indian Party Leader Voice Invariable Support for Korean People
						
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Prakash Karat, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), met with Rim Hoe Song, DPRK ambassador to his country, on Jan. 9.
					 He said that the first New Year Address made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un evoked lively response from the international community, adding many world media vied with each other to report the address.
					
					 The Communist Party of India (Marxist) is pleased with an epochal phase made by the Korean people in their efforts to build an economic giant and reunify the country under the tested leadership of Kim Jong Un, he noted.
					
					 He was convinced that all the tasks set forth by Kim Jong Un would be successfully carried out under his correct leadership.
					
					 The Communist Party of India (Marxist) will always extend invariable support to the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people in their endeavors to build a thriving socialist country and reunify the country, he stressed.

articles.title: Dynamic Movement for Supporting DPRK Called for
articles.content:
Dynamic Movement for Supporting DPRK Called for 
						
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Guy Dupre, secretary general of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea, issued a statement on Jan. 9 in support of the New Year Address made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					 He received the address in great excitement, Guy Dupre said, and went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Un reviewed with pride the proud achievements made by the Korean people in firmly defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country and building a thriving country last year and set forth the tasks to be fulfilled in different sectors.
					
					 The DPRK successfully launched satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2, fully demonstrating the national power of socialist Korea. This was a historic event that helped push forward the building of an economic giant in the new year, too.
					
					 He fully supported the New Year Address on removing the confrontation between the north and the south and respecting and implementing the north-south joint declarations.
					
					 The proposal for reunifying Korea set forth in the address is absolutely sympathized by not only the Korean people but the world progressives as it reflects the desire for national unity and peace, he noted.
					
					 He vowed to wage a more dynamic movement for supporting the DPRK's building of a thriving socialist country and the peaceful reunification of the Korean Peninsula this year which marks the 65th founding anniversary of the DPRK and the 60th anniversary of the victorious Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Poster Exhibition Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Poster Exhibition Held in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- A poster exhibition took place at the Pyongyang International House of Culture from Jan. 7 to 16.
					 Displayed in the exhibition were 60 posters presented by the Mansudae Art Studio, the Central Fine Arts Studio, Pyongyang University of Fine Arts and other institutions.
					
					 Hung on the front wall of the exhibition hall was a poster portraying smiling leader Kim Jong Il, themed "Let Us Glorify the Songun Leadership Feats Performed by Leader Kim Jong Il for All Ages!"
					
					 Among the exhibits was a poster "Let Us Bring about a Radical Turn in the Building of an Economic Giant with the Same Spirit and Mettle as Were Displayed in Conquering Space!", the keynote of the New Year address made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It features the satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 flying into the sky against the background of the red flag.
					
					 Seen in the exhibition were posters "Let's Uphold the Party with Eye-catching Achievements like the Conquerors of the Space!" and "Let's Increase Production of Quality Consumer Goods!"
					
					 What caught the eyes of visitors was the poster "Turn Sepho Tableland into Large-sized Stockbreeding Base!", with herds of goats on pastures pictured in it.
					
					 Also seen in the exhibition were posters "12-year Compulsory Education" and "Let's Make the Whole Country Replete with Sports Enthusiasm!"

articles.title: Japanese Imperialists' Terrorism for Colonial Rule over Korea under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Imperialists' Terrorism for Colonial Rule over Korea under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists committed a lot of crimes to turn Korea into their colony. One of their hideous terrorist acts was their assassination of Kojong who was the emperor of the Feudal Joson Dynasty.
					 In those days they regarded Kojong as a thorn in their flesh as he was stubbornly opposed to their policy of colonial domination over Korea. 
					
					 Kojong made every possible effort to check their moves for aggression as they faked up "treaties" gravely encroaching upon the sovereignty of Korea including the "Ulsa (1905) Five-point Treaty" and vociferated about their "legality".
					
					 He declared the "Ulsa Five-point Treaty" null and void, wrote his personal letters and telegrams in this regard and sent them to heads of state of different countries in 1905 and 1906.
					
					 He sent his emissary to the Second International Peace Conference held in Hague in June 1907 so that he might declare before the world the treaty was invalid. Kojong also sent his secret royal ordinance to patriotic scholars in which he made an appeal for righteous volunteers' struggle. The ordinance called for killing Ito (resident-general) and Hasegawa (commander of the Japanese army in Korea). He put steady pressure upon the pro-Japanese Cabinet installed by the Japanese imperialists under the authority of the emperor, throwing the pro-Japanese lackeys into utter uneasiness.
					
					 On the basis of calculation that if Kojong is allowed to remain on the throne, it will be a stumbling block in the way of executing their policy for colonial domination over Korea, the Japanese imperialists dethroned him and poisoned him to death on Jan. 20, 1919.
					
					 A Japanese book referred to this incident as follows: "Truth about the fact was disclosed at last. The Japanese imperialists ordered their running dog Han Sang Hak to serve Kojong with poisoned meal. In less than one hour Kojong suffered from serious trouble. He breathed his last all of a sudden after groaning in agony. Both eyes of the emperor were red and spots could be seen on all his body. They also made his two waiting maids die all of sudden as they were witnesses to the truth about the incident." 
					
					 It was written in a diary of Yuzaburo Kuratomi, minister for financial examination of the Imperial Household Agency of Japan at that time, that the Japanese Prime Minister instructed his resident general in Korea to poison Kojong to death for the mere reason that he refused to recognize the treaty.
					
					 This irrefutably testifies to the Japanese imperialists' assassination of Kojong.
					
					 It was unprecedented state-sponsored terrorism, a wanton infringement upon the sovereignty of Korea and the dignity of its people.
					
					 Countless are the crimes committed by them against the Korean people.
					
					 They forcibly drafted more than 8.4 million young and middle-aged Koreans to the shambles of wars of aggression and slave labor sites, mercilessly killing over one million Koreans during the colonial fascist rule over Korea.
					
					 They forced 200 000 Korean women into sexual slavery for the imperial Japanese army, mercilessly violating their chastity. 
					
					 What the Japanese imperialists committed against the Korean people were hideous crimes against humanity unprecedented in the history of war for aggression in their brutality, cruelty and craftiness.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries, however, are letting loose a spate of shameless remarks that there is no evidence to prove those crimes, far from making an honest apology and reparation for them. 
					
					 They have become all the more undisguised in their moves to evade the responsibility for the crimes since the emergence of the Abe Cabinet.
					
					 But Japan is seriously mistaken. The Korean people are no longer what used to be in the past when their dignity was trampled down and its sovereignty violated at the point of bayonet of the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will force Japan to pay a thousand-fold price for its past crimes.

articles.title: U.S. MD Disturbs Global Peace and Security: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. MD Disturbs Global Peace and Security: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- At the 8th Russia-China negotiations on strategic security recently held in Beijing, the two countries expressed concerns over the U.S. desperate moves to establish the missile defence system in the Asia-Pacific region and the rest of the world. They agreed to jointly respond to it.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday says in a bylined article in this regard:
					
					 This is a due response to the U.S. MD moves whose danger is increasing day by day.
					
					 The U.S. has so far claimed that the MD is aimed to "protect" America and its allies from the "missile attacks" by the "enemy". It is shameless sophism.
					
					 If the U.S. MD is truly aimed at protection, it should be limited to NATO or territories under its jurisdiction.
					
					 But, the scope of U.S. MD operations covers powers and strategic bases in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 The U.S. has pushed forward the establishment of MD under the pretext of fictitious "threats" from the DPRK. The U.S. aim is to threaten the DPRK by force of arms, stifle it at any moment and contain powers in the region.
					
					 The U.S. completion of the establishment of MD will naturally compel strategic rivals including China and Russia to bolster nuclear and other strategic armed forces.
					
					 All the facts prove that the U.S. MD moves will spark off arms race and seriously threaten and disturb the global peace and security.
					
					 The U.S. dangerous MD moves are bound to meet destruction being denounced and rejected worldwide, the article concludes.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Slammed for Seeking to Pardon Criminals
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Slammed for Seeking to Pardon Criminals 
						
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The Joint Action for Releasing Prisoners of Conscience in south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Jan. 16 denouncing the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for moving to have special pardon granted to their relatives and confidants who were arrested on charges of corruption and irregularities.
					 At the press conference, the organization revealed that Lee Myung Bak is thinking of granting special pardon to Lee Sang Duk, his elder brother, Choe Si Jung, former chairman of the Broadcasting and News Service Committee, Pak Yong Jun, former vice-minister of Knowledge and Economy, the former vice-minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism, etc.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak's proposal for granting special pardon to politicians, his close confidants, without having them stood for trial will naturally touch off resentment of the people.
					
					 Every time Lee issued an order of pardon, he called for the "people's unity", it noted, adding: 
					
					 Pardon should be granted to prisoners of conscience.
					
					 But the present regime is persistently cracking down upon the people in their struggle for right to existence and the progressive social movement, and has refused to grant special pardon to all prisoners of conscience in custody on unreasonable charges.
					
					 Hundreds of prisoners of conscience are now behind bars.
					
					 The organization urged the authorities to stop the moves for special pardon and release the prisoners of conscience.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Plan to Stage North-targeted Drill
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Plan to Stage North-targeted Drill 
						
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The 8th Corps of the south Korean puppet army announced it would stage an offensive drill in Ryongdong, south Korean Kangwon Province from Jan. 21, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The warmongers asserted that the drill which will last till Feb. 1 is aimed at increasing the capability for performing combat duty in winter, adding that huge armed forces and offensive means would be involved in the drill.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak belligerent group is kicking up a military confrontation racket in a bid to bring the dark clouds of a war to this land at any cost.

articles.title: KCTU Stages Sit-in Strike
articles.content:
KCTU Stages Sit-in Strike
						
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Leading members of 67 trade unions of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and other workers affiliated to them staged a protest in Seoul on Jan. 16 in demand of the settlement of the issues of labor including layoff, abolition of part-time jobs and a halt to the action to disband trade unions.
					 Prior to the action, they held a press conference.
					
					 Speakers there described the five years of Lee Myung Bak's office as a period of bitter tears for the workers as they were subject to lay-off, detention and crackdown, adding that they were forced to live like slaves under the present regime.
					
					 A great number of workers were fired to roam the streets, and some of them staged a sit-in strike on the top of steel tower in demand of their vital rights and committed suicides in protest against the layoff, they said, and went on:
					
					 However, the authorities remain a passive onlooker to these tragedies.
					
					 They expressed the determination to stage the second and third strikes in case the authorities refuse to accept their demands.
					
					 At the end of the press conference the workers staged the sit-in strike on the spot.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Reported in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Reported in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The New Year Address made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un were posted on websites Russia and carried by its papers on Jan. 9 and 12.
					 The Organization of the North Caucasus Region of the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks posted on its website and internet paper a photo of Kim Jong Un making the New Year Address with its full text.
					
					 The Young Communist League of Russia posted on its website and paper the full text and gist of the address.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Short Biography Introduced in Nepal
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Short Biography Introduced in Nepal
						
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's short biography was carried by the Nepali newspaper Arpan on January 11.
					 It carried his portrait.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Disseminated in Bulgaria, Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Disseminated in Bulgaria, Democratic Congo
						
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Organizations in Bulgaria and Democratic Congo hosted a seminar and reading session on the dear respected Kim Jong Un's New Year Address between Jan. 5 and 10.
					 They were the Bulgarian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and the Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and the Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Democratic Congo.
					
					 The secretary general of the Bulgarian group said the New Year Address made by Kim Jong Un gave confidence in victory and courage to not only the Korean people but the world progressives aspiring after independence.
					
					 He hoped that the Korean people would achieve more successes in their just efforts to build a thriving socialist country and achieve its independent and peaceful reunification under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A deputy coordinator of the Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in Democratic Congo said the address reflects Kim Jong Un's iron will and far-sighted plan to glorify socialist Korea by carrying forward the intentions of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The chairman of the Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Democratic Congo said the address serves as important guidelines for victoriously advancing the cause of global independence.
					
					 The ardent followers of the Juche idea and the Songun idea will arm themselves with great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and extend full support and solidarity to the Korean people who are striving to carry out the tasks set forth in the address, the chairman added.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Malaysia
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Malaysia
						
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- A Malaysian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Kuala Lumpur on January 13.
					 The manager of the Dombo Enterprise Company of Malaysia was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and feats of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Malaysian Official
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Malaysian Official
						
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The birth of the great Generalissimo Kim Jong Il as the shining star over Mt. Paektu was a great fortune to Korea.
					 The manager of the Dombo Enterprise Company of Malaysia who is the chairman of the Malaysian Preparatory Committee for Celebrating the Day of the Shining Star, Kim Jong Il's birth anniversary, said this on Jan. 13.
					
					 Kim Jong Il frustrated the moves of the imperialist allied forces to stifle the DPRK and firmly defended socialist Korea with his Songun politics in the late last century, the manager noted, adding:
					
					 His desire was to turn the DPRK into an invincible power looked up by the world and make the Korean people the most dignified and happiest people.
					
					 The greatest feat he performed was that he provided a perfect solution to the succession of the revolutionary cause of Juche.

articles.title: Guy Dupre publica declaracion de apoyo al mensaje del ano nuevo de Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Guy Dupre publica declaracion de apoyo al mensaje del ano nuevo de Kim Jong Un
						
Pyongyang, 19 de enero (ACNC) -- El secretario general del Comite Internacional de Enlace por la Reunificacion y la Paz en Corea (CIERECO), Guy Dupre, publico el dia 9 una declaracion en apoyo al mensaje del Ano Nuevo del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					  El dijo que recibio con gran atencion el mensaje del Ano Nuevo de Su Excelencia el Mariscal y continuo:
					
					  En su mensaje, Su Excelencia Kim Jong Un balanceo que el ano pasado, el pueblo coreano defendio firmemente la soberania y la dignidad del pais y logro exitos orgullosos en la construccion del Estado prospero, y presento las tareas por ramas.
					
					  El exitoso lanzamiento de la unidad no. 2 del satelite artificial de la Tierra "Kwangmyongsong-3" fue evento historico que manifesto sin reservas al mundo el poderio nacional de la Corea socialista y permite impulsar la construccion de potencia economica este ano tambien.
					
					  Apoyamos totalmente el mensaje que demanda acabar con el estado de enfrentamiento Norte-Sur y respetar e implementar las declaraciones conjuntas intercoreanas.
					
					  El proyecto de reunificacion de la patria presentado en el mensaje refleja la aspiracion a la unidad nacional y la paz y por esta razon, cuenta con el consentimiento del pueblo coreano y los demas progresistas del mundo.
					
					  Dinamizaremos el movimiento solidario para apoyar la construccion del Estado prospero socialista y la causa de reunificacion pacifica de la Peninsula Coreana en este ano en que el pueblo coreano acoge el 65o aniversario de la fundacion de la RPDC y el 60o de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.

articles.title: Clausurada con exito exposicion de pancartas
articles.content:
Clausurada con exito exposicion de pancartas
						
Pyongyang, 19 de enero (ACNC) -- Quedo clausurada el dia 16 en la Casa Internacional de Cultura de Pyongyang la exposicion de pancartas, iniciada el dia 7.
					En la ocasion fueron exhibidas 60 obras creadas por la Casa de Creacion Mansudae, la Casa Central de Creacion de Bellas Artes, la Universidad de Bellas Artes de Pyongyang, etc. 
					
					En la parte frontal salta a la vista el afiche "!Glorifiquemos generacion tras generacion las imborrables proezas revolucionarias del Songun del gran General!".
					
					La obra deja conocer el espinoso camino del Songun recorrido por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Centro la atencion otra pieza cuyo titulo es la consigna principal presentada por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un en su mensaje del Ano Nuevo: "!Abramos una fase trascendental para la construccion de una potencia economica, con el mismo espiritu y temple con que exploramos el cosmos!".
					
					  En ella estan dibujados los habitantes que bajo la bandera roja con la inscripcion de "Materializacion a ultranza", vitorean el lanzamiento exitoso de la unidad no.2 de satelite artificial "Kwangmyongsong-3".
					
					Otras pancartas "Apoyemos al partido con exitos de trabajo como los conquistadores del cosmos" y "Produzcamos mas articulos de consumo popular de mucha calidad" llaman a todo el pueblo a la construccion de potencia economica.
					
					Se exhibieron tambien "Roturemos la meseta de Sepho para convertirla en gran base ganadera", "Educacion obligatoria de 12 anos", "Levantemos en todo el pais la ola de deportes", etc.

articles.title: ACNC comenta asesinato del emperador coreano Kojong por colonialistas japoneses
articles.content:
ACNC comenta asesinato del emperador coreano Kojong por colonialistas japoneses
Pyongyang, 19 de enero (ACNC) -- En el siglo pasado, el imperialismo japones cometio incontables crimenes para convertir a Corea en colonia suya. 
					Se puede citar como ejemplo el asesinato del emperador de la dinastia feudal de Joson, Kojong, quien rechazo tenazmente la politica de dominacion colonial de Japon.
					
					El se ha esforzado mucho por invalidar el "Tratado de 5 Puntos de Ulsa" y los otros calificados de "legitimos" por los colonialistas si bien los han inventado de manera coercitiva. 
					
					Tras declarar nulo el "Tratado de 5 Puntos de Ulsa", envio en 1905 y 1906 las cartas personales y telegramas de confirmacion a los jefes de Estado de varios paises.
					
					En junio de 1907, el enviado secreto de Kojong revelo a todo el mundo el caracter fraudulento de ese tratado leonino en la II Conferencia Internacional para la Paz celebrada en La Haya, Holanda. 
					
					El emperador envio a los eruditos patrioticos el mandato imperial secreto llamandoles a la lucha de voluntarios antijaponeses por eliminar al gobernador general japones Ito Hirobumi y al comandante del ejercito japones ocupante de Corea, Hasegawa.
					
					Presiono con la autoridad imperial al gabinete projapones de Corea, fabricado por los colonialistas. 
					
					Considerando a Kojong como espina atravesada en la garganta, los imperialistas japoneses lo destronaron por la fuerza y lo envenenaron el 20 de enero de 1919.
					
					En un libro japones esta referido ese hecho como sigue: "La verdad se ha revelado. El imperialismo japones hizo a su lacayo Han Sang Hak dar una comida envenenada a Kojong. En menos de una hora, el emperador murio agonizando. Tenia los ojos enrojecidos y la piel cubierta de granos ya en putrefaccion. Tambien resultaron muertas de repente dos sirvientas que presenciaron el hecho". 
					
					El asesinato de Kojong fue un crimen terrorista de Estado que violo flagrantemente la soberania y la dignidad de la nacion coreana.
					
					Durante el periodo de dominacion fascista colonial sobre Corea, el imperialismo japones arresto de manera forzosa a mas de 8 millones 400 mil jovenes y adultos coreanos para lanzarlos a los campos de guerra y de trabajos duros y de ellos mas de un millon fueron asesinados. 
					
					200 mil mujeres coreanas fueron convertidas en contra de su voluntad en esclavas sexuales para el viejo ejercito nipon. 
					
					En lugar de pedir disculpas e indemnizar esos crimenes de lesa humanidad, los reaccionarios japoneses dicen ahora que no hay testimonios que puedan probarlos. 
					
					Tales actos cinicos se cometen mas abiertamente despues de la aparicion del nuevo gabinete de Abe. 
					
					Japon esta equivocado. 
					
					El pueblo coreano no es el de ayer.
					
					El ejercito y pueblo coreanos cobraran sin falta el precio de todos los crimenes referidos arriba.
